definition: apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

sentences.english: We should respect our teachers. You shouldn't have answered your teacher back in class。
sentences.chinese: 我們應當尊敬老師，你不該在課上同老師頂嘴。

sentences.english: Tom was punished for talking back to the teacher.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆因和老師頂嘴而受到處罰。

sentences.english: She does not like to contradict her husband in public.
sentences.chinese: 她不喜歡當衆與丈夫頂嘴。

sentences.english: The second time, I was a little bit older and talked back to my mother.
sentences.chinese: 第二次是在我稍大一些的時候，原因是跟母親頂嘴。

sentences.english: He was disciplined at school for talking back to the teacher.
sentences.chinese: 他因爲和教師頂嘴受到了處分。

sentences.english: No child should be allowed to answer back.
sentences.chinese: 不應該允許任何孩子頂嘴。

sentences.english: He knew better than to talk back to his father.
sentences.chinese: 他知道最好還是不要和他父親頂嘴。

sentences.english: He lose his job serval times just because talk back.
sentences.chinese: 他年輕時，只不過因爲敢頂嘴，就失業了好幾次。

sentences.english: In his youth he lost several jibs , just because he dared to answer back.
sentences.chinese: 他年輕時，只不過敢頂嘴，就失業了好幾次。

sentences.english: In his youth he lost several jobs, just because he dared to talk back.
sentences.chinese: 他年青時，只不過因爲敢頂嘴，就失業了好幾次。

sentences.english: Robert had the impudence to talk back to his teacher.
sentences.chinese: 羅伯竟狂妄得跟老師頂嘴。

sentences.english: Who dares to answer back when he roars like a lion?
sentences.chinese: 當他像獅子般咆哮時，誰敢和他頂嘴？

definition: to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
